item.name: Meeting

request.description:
Create a meeting with name, description, address and date.
When you create a meeting you are the host
You id as a user is the meeting hostId.

response.name: Create a meeting 2
Create a meeting

query.description: Order  by id, name, description, date, location.country, location.state, location.city, location.street, location.number  (default id)

request.description: List all meetings with id, name, description, address, date, hostId and  a participants list with some information such as: id, firstName, lastName, username, email

response.name: List meetings

query.description: Order  by id, name, description, date, location.country, location.state, location.city, location.street, location.number  (default id)

request.description:
List all meetings with id, name, description, address, date, createdAt, updatedAt and  a participants list with some information such as: id, firstName, lastName, username, email, isAdmin, createdAt, updatedAt.
And host information like: id, firstName, lastName, username, email, isAdmin, createdAt, updatedAt

response.name: Detail one meeting
response.body:
{
    "meeting": {
        "id": 1,
        "name": "Test Meeting",
        "description": "This is my first Test Meeting",
        "date": "2020-02-24T03:33:53.000Z",
        "createdAt": "2020-03-02T04:59:47.765Z",
        "updatedAt": "2020-03-02T04:59:47.765Z",
        "host": {
            "id": 1,
            "firstName": "test",
            "lastName": "test",
            "username": "test",
            "email": "test@test.com",
            "isAdmin": true,
            "createdAt": "2020-03-02T04:54:35.980Z",
            "updatedAt": "2020-03-02T04:54:35.980Z"
        },
        "location": {
            "country": "Mexico",
            "state": "Jalisco",
            "city": "Guadalajara",
            "street": "Buenavista",
            "number": "35",
            "reference": "Frente al Costo"
        },
        "participants": []
    }
}

request.description:
Update a meeting, name, description, address and date.
there are 2 rules in this endpoint:
1. Only the host user can update the meeting
2. Admin user can update the meeting without be the host

response.name: Update a meeting

request.description:
Delete a meeting.
there are 2 rules in this endpoint:
1. Only the host user can delete the meeting
2. Admin user can delete the meeting without be the host

item.description:
This is the section for meetings, you can create, list, detail, update and delete meetings
you need a token for this sub section (you can go to public/login for one)
There are some rules that are depending of the specific endpoint, and they are mentioned in the certain endpoint

item.name: user

request.description: Create a user with firstName, lastName, username, email, isAdmin (optional, default false) and password

response.name: Create a not admin user, example 2

request.description: List all user with id, firstName, lastName, username, email, and isAdmin

item.description:
This is the section for users, you can create, list, detail, update, enrole to meeting, leave a meeting and delete users
you need a token for this sub section (you can go to public/login for one)

There are some rules that are depending of the specific endpoint, and they are mentioned in the certain endpoint
